revised_title: Investigation of Specific Heat and Electrical Resistance in Copper-Iron Alloys
tldr: The authors measured the specific heat and electrical resistance of copper-iron alloys, focusing on those showing a minimum in electrical resistance at low temperatures. They found specific heat anomalies that likely extend from the absolute zero of temperature to the region of the resistance minimum. The entropy contents of these anomalies suggest that only two energy states of the iron ions are involved in the resistance minimum phenomena.
